reviews.review_msg: I really feel for the prof: he's obviously passionate abt the topic, but lectures are a 3hr drag (and this is coming from someone who's interested). There's no participation mark, It's 50% midterm, 50% final - just know basics of readings & of his slide info. He posts on Canvas what material will be on exams.

Michel is a great human being and the way he teaches reflects this, I thoroughly enjoyed in class discussions and learned a lot. However, if you are a student who needs clear translation of the material I don't recommend. I did have a hard time prepping for exams because of how broad some in class discussions got. Overall though really interesting!

He genuinely cares about his students learning something useful for their lives and he also wants all of them to do well. Lecture can be long but he tries to make it interesting. Definitely should take this course with him if you're thinking about it  by the way, if you're reading this Michel, thanks being an awesome prof! :)

This course is very interesting. Prof. Joffres explains things in a very detailed manner and makes it fun. Sometime he might jump around a little bit but eventually topics connect with each other. Very easy to approach and encourages participation. Would  take again. Only draw back is that the course is marked on 2 exams as I'm not good at exams.

I took this course as a Health Science elective because the topic seemed slightly interesting. However as the semester progressed, I found that I was really into the material since my family has had conventional and non-conventional medical treatments. Clear exams and interesting lectures. Recommend!

Show up, listen, two easy exams and *BAM!* easy A. Lectures are extremely long and discussion based, which can often end in about half the class in silence. Examines specific things he's said, but a lot are common sense. Reading is somewhat necessary, but he literally tells you to just read the abstract and conclusion.

This class was very unpredictable at first because 3 hour lectures tend to be boring, but as the days went by, I really learned to enjoy the content of the course. It was the best course in SFU hands down.
I just graduated and I can say that I remember more from this course compared to my 4th year courses! That's because the material is practical and actually useful.
Honestly the material was interesting enough that it could be a 6 credit course. Overall, the lectures are long but the prof does demonstrations and examples so I would recommend him.

Out of all the profs I've had Dr. Joffres was very different. Different in a good way because he didn't spoon feed us and as long as we participated and read the papers, a high grade was very achievable. I recommend this prof!
One of the best professors that I've ever had. Very concerned with student learning and has a firm grasp on the material. Not to mention, he is a medical doctor!

Michel was very interested in the material. 50% mid term and final was intimidating but the tests are fairly easy. He encourages participation in class which is nonexistent and makes some of the lectures feel awkward. Three hour lecture drags on forever and even if the material is covered in the first two hours he will drag out one more hour.

Overall a great prof, seems to be really into what he is teaching as is funny at times! Having a 3 hour lecture once a week is a little long, but he does give breaks every hour so just grab yourself a coffee and you are good to go until the end! Reading the articles before the lecture is a good idea.

This class would have been better if it wasn't 3 hours straight. Joffres is interested and passionate about the topics and kept the class fairly interesting. Only marking was the midterm and final, which were majority multiple choice. No textbook, just lots of article reading. Pay attention to videossupplemental media in class and you will do fine

Dr. Joffres is overall a great prof because I got used to reading academic articles and the content of the course was very interesting. Some papers were hard to comprehend but most of the content and videos in class are really interesting I recommend this class for sure

People may bash him for his lack of preparation, but I think he is wonderful. He may not be available to help all the time, but he encourages students to bond to help each other. Most students who read the readings will easily fly away with a B. If you really wanted to learn something out of this class I recommend looking at the articles in depth.
Super easy class. lectures were boring. But in the end I do use the knowledge that I learned a lot in real life situations!! Super light course with no readings because he goes over it all in class

I liked this class. It taught me to look at things in a different way. Joffres was a great prof. Some of the lectures were very boring, while others were fine. Did not study for the final and got an A.
Dr. Joffres is a pretty good professor in that he tells you exactly what to know for the exams. Lectures; however, can be a bit dry. Overall: would recommend.
he's nice and quite knowledgable but quite boring. Lectures seem very repetitive, however, he's pretty easy.

Clearly the person below me doesn`t even know the difference between than and then so his/her opinion is invalid. This class is flexible and open to discussion. It would be even better if there were clickers.  Dr. Joffres is very competent though.

This course and the way it was taught was a joke. We spent 3 painful hours basically discussing the opinions of the class. If you need an easy mark, its not that difficult to achieve. Test questions include class discussions rather then actual information, but  overall I felt that I learnt nothing.
Very dull lectures, hard to stay awake, prof is very disorganized.

I personally found this class to be hard at the beginning, but I was so wrong!!! I actually began to like the course because the prof made it clear what was going to be on the exam and I couldn't ask for more. Dr. Joffres is one of my favorite profs at SFU. I have no idea why people would rate him as bad..

The prof is very knowledgeable and proficient in the material he teaches, so you learn very interesting things! The course is not bad at all if you actually just come to class and read the articles. He has very CLEAR guidelines as to what is going to be on the exam so you save a lot of time studying!!

The only reason people may think this course is boring is if they do not complete the readings. This is a very engaging and interesting class because it is actually applicable to your own life! There is no need to spend several hours memorizing. As long as you are engaged in the class and complete the readings, you can do well. Excellent prof!

Let me tell you the truth. Everyone below me who rated him as a terrible prof are just either really stupid or don't know how to study. I LITERALLY studied for 3 days max for his exams which were 50% each and I thought I would fail because there's a lot of material to know, but with minimal studying I pulled of an A+ so all you need is 3 days.
Good prof. If you want to make the most out if this course, make sure you participate, and encourage others to do so as well. If no ones participates his class can get really boring.

One of the most disorganized Profs I have ever come across throughout my 3 years here at SFU. He never comes to class prepared. He assigns 5-6 papers each week, and yes some of which were 10 pages long. He is not clear about what to study for the exams. His class consists of 50% midterm and 50% final. AVOID this prof!

ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE PROF. He has no idea how to teach, just tries to establish discussions on topics he hasn't even touched on. He assigns WAYYY too much reading (4-6 articles per week) and expects us to remember random facts from the article for the midterm and final which are worth 50% each. Don't ever take his class. Avoid like the plague.

TERRIBLE prof. Very unclear as to what is important to know for the exams, which is unfortunate with 50% of your mark coming from the midterm and 50% coming from the final. Tries to treat lectures like a tutorial without educating us first.

I did not enjoy this class at all. The prof was not very clear on what we needed to know for the exam, and the exams were harder than I expected. A lot of stuff you have to memorize. One midterm worth 50% and one final worth 50%

Never explains about the essays and videos that we should know. He just assigns u to read average 5 essays per week (10 pages long for each). His power point is useless and he never prepares for the lecture but he teaches for 3 hours while we are doing absolutely nothing. Half of class never come to lecture and another half leaves while break time

Great prof. Learned a lot of interesting things. Lectures were a little on the disorganized side but the supplementary material really helped clarify the concepts. Knows how to incorporate humour into his lectures. :)

Knowledgeable teacher who is very passionate about his courses. His lecs are not dry since he tends to mix in humor. You will def do well in the course if you READ the text and use his notes. I believe a lot of the bad reviews are from students who rely too heavily on the assumption that he is an easy teacher and therefore do not put in any effort!

His classes are meant for individuals who can take chances to put their hands up, he is very helpful in helping understand the concepts of the class, and examines fairly. There is reading involved and out of class work (roughly an hour a week) He presents useful information about concepts and doesn't bog students down. It is an interactive course.

Very interesting class from a Knowledgeable teacher-Surprised to see comments from other students that are totally irrelevant and so mean spirited. Does not reflect what I saw- Must be from those getting poor grades and totally missing the point.

The topic seemed very interesting...too bad we didn't really get into it much. I have to admit though that the class was really easy, although to the point that it was kind of ridiculous. Lectures were really disorganized and we often spent an hour only going over a few slides. He's a nice guy but I really don't recommend taking this class with him
Terrible Prof! He's a relatively nice guy and an easy marker but he's confusing and doesn't prepare for lectures. Don't expect to learn much if you take a class with him.

He's a nice guy but his lectures are terrible. His ppt notes are pretty bad and it's obvious that he doesn't come prepared for class. One day we spent 3 hours listening to him read online articles to us which he was finding on the spot. Although his exams are ridiculously easy, his grading scheme sucks and I pretty much didn't learn anything at all

Lecture slides + His words + online material are keys to success in this course. Course materials hard to understand sometimes because of his teaching style and stories. In-class assignments are easy marks so do well in them.  Nice guy but his scaling of grades is misleading somewhat...

He takes extremely interesting course material and butchers it. His exams are ridiculous and his scaling is as well. If you have a problem with your exam or the grading, good luck. He doesn't care. He'll tell you to stop whining and just brush you off. AVOID HIS CLASSES!!!

WORST PROFESSOR EVER!!! His wording makes no sense, takes him a whole 2 hour class to make a single point and he NEVER gets through all the lecture slides because he's too busy getting the class to talk about personal stories that no one cares about at all. It's a complete waste of time and a total shame.

HSCI 140 is pretty useless.  I can't say I learned much during the entire semester. Michel's notes and lectures are disorganized and it's pretty obvious that he doesn't prepare for class at all. That being said, the class is however extremely easy. Too bad his scaling of grades totally sucks. Who considers an 89 a B+??

Michel is a great, funny guy, but puts little effort into his presentations or teaching. I found the class unorganized. He reuses exam material, so if you see an old or a practice exam, study it! All practice material appeared on our exams, which inflated the class average. These numbers sadly do not reflect his teaching ability!
A great Proff! Class is super interesting, presents the course in a fun way, lectures are easy to follow. Has great in class discussions that get everyone involved!

Very funny good humored prof. Lecture format is more open to dialogue with class, and drawing on his experience as he is a M.D. If you are interested in the politics of medicine and want a perspective you don't get from the typical doctor, then take this class.  refreshing change. Keeners, are the only one complaining about lack of structure,

Michel is a very easy prof for his HSCI-140 class, too bad it is very disorganized. Although it is a course for an easy A, I didn't learn much from this course. It seemed like a waste of $300-400 for this course, but I guess the GPA boost was a plus.
omg the easiest prof ever.  he has a good sense of humour but his lectures have no structure and barely anyone attended them.  take this course if u need to boost your GPA.
Great guy, so funny. And the class was a breeze.

True, the course material is pretty dull...but this is a pretty easy class taught by a pretty nice professor. The only downside is that he's changing the format of the course next semester so it will likely involve a paper.
He is very funny, his tests are ridicously easy and his class is very interesting. Only problem though is that the class is not well organized, but thats probably because it is a new class.
